name: paperless-atom
readme:
# Paperless for Atom
![A screenshot of your package](http://i.imgur.com/nGPLzI7.png)

This package lets Atom manipulate lists created with
[Paperless](http://crushapps.com/paperless/), a
list-making app by [Jim Rhoades](https://twitter.com/crushapps) for iOS devices. Presently in alpha, the package has little error handling, and only supports modifying existing notes.

At present, there are planned enhancements for adding/removing/reordering lists and items, followed by tightening up the code and UI a bit.

# Install
```bash
$ apm install paperless-atom
```
or open Atom and go to Preferences > Install and search for `paperless-atom`

# Usage
## Launching
Open your Paperless folder with Atom _(Right-Click -> "Open with Atom")_, then press
Ctrl+Alt+L to run the command `paperless-atom:open` and launch Paperless for Atom.

Alternate launch method: Right-Click on the Paperless folder in Atom's Tree View and choose "Open folder in Paperless mode."

## Working with lists
Click on a List on the left to select it, which will populate the Items
column in the center. Click on an Item to select it and display it's
Notes. If you modify these notes and would like to retain your changes,
click the Save button in the upper right.

# Caveats
Synchronization is very naive, it is therefore unwise to simultaneously
use both `paperless-atom` and the iOS Paperless app; when you're done
working in Atom, close it out before using the iOS app, and vice-versa.

**THIS IS ALPHA SOFTWARE!** It might destroy all of your data. Use it with caution.

# Credits and Support
[Peter Bessman](http://peterbessman.com) is the author of Paperless for Atom. Send comments, bugs, and requests to <paperless@peterbessman.com>.
